description.full: This class is integrated into the openframeworks events system. When a mouse event (mouse pressed, mouse released...) happens we record mouse information inside an object of the class. Used to send event messages. In the new openFrameworks release we can find a very illustrative example about how to use events in openFrameworks.

document:
#class ofMouseEventArgs

<!-- visible: True advanced: False istemplated: False extends: ofEventArgs -->

##InlineDescription

##Description

This class is integrated into the openframeworks events system. When a mouse event (mouse pressed, mouse released...) happens we record mouse information inside an object of the class. Used to send event messages. In the new openFrameworks release we can find a very illustrative example about how to use events in openFrameworks.

raw:
#class ofMouseEventArgs


<!--
_visible: True_
_advanced: False_
_istemplated: False_
_extends: ofEventArgs_
-->

##InlineDescription






##Description

This class is integrated into the openframeworks events system. When a mouse event (mouse pressed, mouse released...) happens we record mouse information inside an object of the class. Used to send event messages. In the new openFrameworks release we can find a very illustrative example about how to use events in openFrameworks.
